snippet: The president has said he will seek more encounters in his last year with people who disagree with him, though recent events have drawn supportive crowds.
abstract: White House Memo; Pres Obama visits Nebraska and Louisiana after his State of the Union Address, part of what his aides say is his desire to speak to Americans who disagree with him; president is welcome in each state, however, by largely Democratic and supportive crowds.
lead_paragraph: The president has said he will seek more encounters in his last year with people who disagree with him, though recent events have drawn supportive crowds.

headline.print_headline: In Post-Speech Travels, Obama Finds Little but Love
headline.main: In Conservative Louisiana, Obama Finds Little but Love
